cycronix.ctlib

Class CTwriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • cycronix.ctlib.CTwriter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CTftp

    public class CTwriter
extends Object
    A class to write data to CloudTurbine folder/files.

      • setTimeRelative

      • setBlockMode

        public void setBlockMode(boolean bflag)
        Set binary packed block mode output.

        A "block" is comprised of all putData (per channel) up to each flush(). The point times in a block are linearly interpolated start-to-end over block.

        The start time of a block is the setTime() at the first putData(). The end time of a block is the setTime() at the flush().

        Known issue: back-to-back block times may overlap/gap... needs to be reviewed.

        Parameters:
        bflag - true/false set block mode (default: false)

      • setByteSwap

        public void setByteSwap(boolean bswap)
        Set byte-swap mode for all binary output. false: Intel little-endian, true: Java/network big-endian
        default: false
        Parameters:
        bswap - byte swap true/false

      • setGZipMode

        public void setGZipMode(boolean gzipflag)
        Gzip (.gz) files in addition to regular zip (.zip) somewhat experimental
        Parameters:
        gzipflag - gzip mode true/false (default: false)

      • setZipMode

        public void setZipMode(boolean zipflag)
        set whether output files are to be zipped.
        Parameters:
        zipflag - zip files true/false (default: true)

      • setZipMode

        public void setZipMode(boolean zipflag,
              int clevel)
        set output files to be zipped setting compression level
        Parameters:
        zipflag - zip mode true/false (default: true)
        clevel - zip compression level (1=none, 9-max, 10=auto-gzip). default=1: best-speed

      • setTime

        public void setTime()
        Set time for subsequent putData().

        With no argument, calls: setTime(System.currentTimeMillis()).
        If setTime() not called, time is automatically set to current time each putData().

      • setTime

        public void setTime(long ftime)
        Set time for subsequent putData().
        Parameters:
        ftime - time (msec)

      • setTime

        public void setTime(double ftime)

        Parameters:

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws IOException
        Write collected entries to .zip file.

        No-op for regular (non-zip) files.

        Throws:
        IOException

      • flush

        public void flush(boolean gapless)
           throws IOException
        Write collected entries to .zip file
        Parameters:
        gapless - true/false auto-set end time of this zip file to start of next
